title: Tides of the Blue
subtitle: Stories from the living ocean
description: Drift from sunlit shallows to abyssal plains while the sea narrates its own memory in color, pressure, and pulse.

pages.title: Breathe with the Sea
body: At dawn, the ocean mirrors the sky—coral and cobalt painted across a moving horizon, salt on the air, foam on your lips.
Every inhale tastes like distance; every exhale threads you to the tides as sunlight braids itself into waves.
Stay here a moment—feel how the sea carries the memory of mountains ground to sand and stories whispered across centuries.
You float in a cathedral of moving glass; the pews are ripples, the hymns are gull cries, the incense is brine.
Somewhere beyond the swell, whales trade paragraphs of song; their voices arc through water like pen strokes on vellum.

pages.title: Rivers Within the Sea
body: Currents ferry heat and life—slow spirals that stitch hemispheres together, moving plankton, song, and salt.
Gyres write invisible calligraphy on the surface, patient handwriting that takes seasons to finish a single loop.
Satellites watch the eddies bloom and fade, each swirl a fingerprint of motion, each whirlpool a brief kingdom of drifting light.
Beneath the skin, thermoclines step down like chapters—warm on top, then cool, then the deep paragraph where light forgets its name.
Currents are the sea's memory made moving; they remember where heat was born, where salt was shed, and where storms exhaled.
pages.emphasis: The Gulf Stream moves 150 Sverdrups—more than 300 Amazon Rivers combined.

pages.title: Reef Cities
body: Coral cities turn hard sunlight into softness—color, refuge, and resonance humming through limestone streets.
Polyps lay down limestone skyscrapers grain by grain, tenants of their own architecture, housing a carnival of species.
Fish gossip in currents between coral towers, while shrimp drum on shells and parrotfish carve sand from stone.
Night flips the switch: bioluminescent scripts run across the reef, neon margins on a living manuscript.
Every crevice is a library of microhabitats, shelved with brittle stars, tucked-in blennies, and the quiet punctuation of clams closing.

pages.title: Listening to the Deep
body: Breakthroughs that revealed the ocean's pulse, translating mystery into maps, and silence into measurable rhythm.
Each discovery is a lantern lowered down the water column, turning rumor into contour and echo into chart.

timeline.title: 1872 — Challenger
timeline.subtitle: First global survey
timeline.description: The HMS Challenger logged 68,000 miles, launching modern oceanography.

timeline.title: 1943 — Aqua-Lung
timeline.subtitle: Breathing underwater
timeline.description: Cousteau and Gagnan's regulator opened the ocean to human exploration.

timeline.title: 1977 — Hydrothermal vents
timeline.subtitle: Life without sunlight
timeline.description: Black smokers at the Galápagos Rift revealed chemosynthetic ecosystems.

timeline.title: 2016 — Argo 3,000
timeline.subtitle: Global floats
timeline.description: A fleet of profiling floats now sends back temperature and salinity from every ocean.

pages.title: Guardians of the Blue
body: Map your own tide story—pair local footage with data, with music, with the meteorology of your own coastline.
Swap chapters, colors, and soundscapes to match your memory of the sea; let the JSON be your pen and the water your ink.
Every edit is a tidepool of choice—what you include, what you omit, what you let drift back into the deep.
